p: Let's see what I can offer with this wiki.
These links will give you canva pro for lifetime a while, so use any one of them or join all. If any of them don't work let me know in discord : blooem#2550.

These ones below won't probably work. They are mostly the dumps of the ones above with expired links or full seats. You can still try and see if any of them work, but better not to waste time with these.
Will add more links when I get some free time.
Follow these steps to manually extract hardcoded subs and change them to softcoded ones. This is quite a long method, so I will make another guide for a more better and faster one soon.
After arranging it like said so, make a new txt file and save the timestamps only, and make another txt and save the text only. Donot change the format.
Change the mode to Filmstrip(top-mid) and use arrow keys to go through the images. When you see subs add label using Ctrl + 6. Do this for all images excluding empty and duplicate ones.

Correct, correct and correct! Use the waveform feature to correct. Trust me this tool will make it 100 times easier. You will now have to give time to correct the timing and any missing text and after done save it as something.srt.
Create image files for every second (for long movies create img files every 2 or even 3 secs).
Crop the video with the subs part only. For a 1980* 1280 video I did the following crop:

Doing that manually will take a lot of time so you can automate it with python using regex or something of your choice. I used the substitution function in this Regex101 website, so didn't had to write any code.
Google docs has 60 page ocr limit.
I used PlusJakartaSansRegular font but you can use any other font and make sure the font file is properly installed.

Now again, go to import and import the time only file with Time Code option. Then go to tools and and choose adjust durations, check the recalcuate option and click ok. You will now get a base subtitle file that you can work with.
Now it's time to correct the subs. For each timestamp move the subs inline (timestamps and the correspoding subs on the same line).
Now select all the images, right click and print them all to one pdf. (Make sure to uncheck fit picture to frame otherwise the photo will be cropped which we really don't want).

Now we will seperate the duplicate and empty image files using Adobe Bridge. Use the label feature of adobe bridge to label the images apart from the duplicate and empty ones and do sort by label. Then select all the images and download them to a different folder.
Now, add a timestamp to your cropped video. DO:

Now, we're going to use Subtitle Edit program to make the srt file. Go to File Import Plain text and open the text only file. Make sure One line is one subtitle checkbox is selected and then click ok.
PS: I had a 48 min long video for which I created images every 3 sec and got 969 images. That's a lot of images to go through so do not even try every 1 or 2 sec for long videos.

Then, you can either use an OCR tool that can extract text from the whole pdf, but such tools are hard to find/are locked behind paywall. What I like to do is split the pdf into multiple pdfs with 60 pages each using Adobe acrobat tool online and use google docs to extract the text.

Upload all the pdfs to google drive, do right click and open with docs. Opening with google docs will automatically extract the sub text along with the timestamp. Open each file and copy all the text to a notepad. Repeat for all pdfs.
You can use anyformat for the video but, I will convert the video to mp4 format first.
Get your shiny custom domain for your E5 developer account.
If you haven't then follow this guide: E5 Guide
Go to this website and sign up.
Click New Domain and fill up the domain name.
Check server names for the Check for correctness of: and set NS1.HE.NET for Name1, NS2.HE.NET for Name2, and accordingly for NS3.HE.NET, NS4.HE.NET, NS5.HE.NET.
Wait for 24hours (i think), or few days to get the domain registered. You will receive an email when that happens.
Add your website to cloudflare and change your nameservers to the ones provided by cloudflare.
It might take an hour or so for your domain to appear in cloudflare.
Go to your admin center and to this page: Manage Domains
Click Add a new domain and add your new something.eu.org domain there.
It will now ask you to verify your domain. Choose the first option aka Add a TXT record to the domain's DNS records.
Go to DNS management for your website. Add a new new record with TXT as type, @ as name and MS=ms########(unique ID from the admin center) as your content. Set TTL to 30min.
You can use this website to validate if TXT record has been updated.
After adding those records, click verify and it should do so without errors.

Assuming my domain is something.eu.org, the page will ask you to add something as your host name, but literally adding something will give you error like We didn't detect that you added this record. We are supposed to use @ for this case in the host name.

Go to the DNS management and add a new record. Use MX as type, @ as name, and copy the "Points to address or value" value in your microsoft page and use it as content. Set 0 for priority and 1hr for TTL.
With CNAME as type for a new record, set the autodiscover as your name, autodiscover.outlook.com as your target and 1hr for TTL.
Add a new record. Use TXT as type, @ as name, and copy the TXT value (it should be v=spf1 include:spf.protection.outlook.com -all) in your microsoft page and use it as content. Set TTL to 1hr.
Some materials that will help in preparing for the reading section of SAT. ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
Also see: Gerald Graff, Cathy Birkenstein, and Russell Durst: Tiley Say/I Say: The Moves that Matter in Academic Writing, 2nd Edition. New York: W.W. Norton and Company, 2009.
Fiction, suggested authors: Julia Alvarez, Jane Austen, Charlotte/ Anne Bronte, Michael Chabon, Charles Dickens, Jhumpa Lahiri, Toni Morrison, George Orwell, Edith Wharton
For links to many additional resources
New York Times: www.nytimes.com(particularly the Science section)

Note: If you are seeking additional resources for graphic-based questions, you may want to work with Science sections from released ACTs. Although somewhat more challenging than SAT data analysis questions overall, they nevertheless require many of the same skills tested on the SAT. In addition to the tests in 77ze Official ACT Prep Guide, several more authentic exams are available online.
Science and Social Science Authors: Daniel Kahneman, Malcolm Gladwell, Adam Grant, Daniel Levitin, Brian Greene, Stephen Hawking, Lisa Randall
Abraham Lincoln, Stephen Douglass, Daniel Webster
Benjamin Franklin, Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, Alexander Hamilton
Frederick Douglass, William Lloyd Garrison, Herny Ward Beecher, Harriet Beecher Stowe
Martin Luther King, Jr., Malcolm X, Fannie Lou Hamer, John F. Kennedy
Ralph Waldo Emerson, Henry David Thoreau
Susan B. Anthony, Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Lucretia Mott, Angelina and Sarah Grimke (also active in the Abolitionist Movement)
Upton Sinclair, Jane Addams, Ida Tarbell, Jacob Riis, WEB DuBois, Booker T. Washington
Alexis de Tocqueville: Democracy in America
Angelina Grimke: Letters to Catherine E. Beecher
Catherine Beecher: An Essay on Slavery and Abolitionism
Edmund Burke: Reflections on the Revolution in France
Elizabeth Stanton: History of Woman Suffrage
